course_title: Fresh Sem: Poli Sci: Modeling Politics
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)


This freshman seminar is an introduction to the three most important approaches to mathematical modeling in political science: (1) statistical modeling, (2) systems modeling, and (3) rational choice / game theory modeling. This introductory treatment is the best way to become familiar with these approaches to political science research, and this seminar is perfect for those who may be thinking about pursuing the "very cool" joint major in political science and mathematics. Students will write about mathematical approaches to social science. Students are not required to solve any mathematics in the course.
course_description: For first-year students only. Entry level seminar focusing on a specific topic. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
